                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 1,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        74.25,
                                        504.0,
                                        84.31
                                    ],
                                    "text": "while maintaining exact answers (Niepert and Van den Broeck, 2014). By using logical variables"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        85.18,
                                        504.0,
                                        95.21
                                    ],
                                    "text": "in parameterised randvars (PRVs) to represent groups of indistinguishable randvars, lifted variable"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        96.07,
                                        504.0,
                                        106.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "elimination operating on PFGs is able to allow for tractable probabilistic inference with respect to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        107.09,
                                        504.0,
                                        117.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "domain sizes of logical variables (Taghipour et al., 2013a). After its first introduction, lifted variable"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        117.93,
                                        504.0,
                                        127.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "elimination has been steadily refined by many researchers to reach its current form (De Salvo Braz"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        128.78,
                                        504.0,
                                        138.83
                                    ],
                                    "text": "et al., 2005, 2006; Milch et al., 2008; Kisy´nski and Poole, 2009; Taghipour et al., 2013b; Braun and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        139.78,
                                        505.24,
                                        149.74
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Möller, 2018). Recently, Luttermann et al. (2024a,b) extend PFGs to incorporate causal knowledge,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        150.65,
                                        504.0,
                                        160.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "thereby allowing for lifted causal inference in addition to lifted probabilistic inference. In any case"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        161.52,
                                        504.67,
                                        171.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(purely probabilistic or causal), the construction of a PFG (or its causal extension, respectively)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        172.43,
                                        505.65,
                                        182.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "is necessary to apply lifted inference algorithms afterwards. The “CompressFactorGraph” algo-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        183.34,
                                        504.67,
                                        193.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "rithm (Kersting et al., 2009; Ahmadi et al., 2013) builds on work by Singla and Domingos (2008)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        194.25,
                                        504.0,
                                        204.31
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and detects symmetries in an FG to obtain possible groups of randvars and factors by deploying a"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        205.21,
                                        505.24,
                                        215.2
                                    ],
                                    "text": "colour passing procedure similar to the Weisfeiler-Leman algorithm (Weisfeiler and Leman, 1968),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        216.14,
                                        504.0,
                                        226.1
                                    ],
                                    "text": "which is commonly used to test for graph isomorphism. To obtain a valid PFG, the resulting groups"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        227.0,
                                        505.65,
                                        237.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "must be represented by introducing logical variables in PRVs, and the current state-of-the-art algo-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        237.88,
                                        504.0,
                                        247.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "rithm to construct a valid PFG entailing equivalent semantics as an initially given FG is the ACP"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        248.79,
                                        504.0,
                                        258.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "algorithm (Luttermann et al., 2024c,d,e). While ACP successfully constructs a valid PFG from a"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        259.78,
                                        504.0,
                                        269.74
                                    ],
                                    "text": "given FG, it requires all potentials of factors to be scaled by the same scalar, which imposes a serious"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        270.68,
                                        504.0,
                                        280.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "limitation for practical applications, e.g., when potentials are learned from various data sources and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        281.6,
                                        375.05,
                                        291.56
                                    ],
                                    "text": "normalisation is undesirable due to floating point arithmetic issues."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        298.0,
                                        505.65,
                                        307.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "To circumvent the requirement of equally scaled potential values in all factors, we propose a modifi-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        308.82,
                                        505.25,
                                        318.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "cation of the ACP algorithm that encodes potential values of factors as vectors. In an earlier work,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        319.8,
                                        504.0,
                                        329.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Gehrke et al. (2020) show that potentials of factors can be conceived as vectors such that the cosine"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        330.68,
                                        504.0,
                                        340.68
                                    ],
                                    "text": "similarity provides a useful measure to check whether factors “behave similarly”, thereby allowing"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        341.57,
                                        504.35,
                                        351.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "to keep symmetries over time and to avoid groundings during temporal probabilistic inference. By"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        352.61,
                                        504.0,
                                        362.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "using vector representations of factors’ potentials, the potentials do not have to be scaled by the same"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        363.44,
                                        504.0,
                                        373.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "scalar and thus, we make use of this property already during the construction procedure of the PFG in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        374.37,
                                        504.0,
                                        384.3
                                    ],
                                    "text": "this paper. Detecting symmetries independent of scalars already during the construction of the lifted"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        385.2,
                                        504.0,
                                        395.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "representation (i.e., before lifted inference takes place) yields a more compact representation right"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        396.09,
                                        504.35,
                                        406.15
                                    ],
                                    "text": "from the beginning and thereby significantly speeds up online inference afterwards. We formally"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        407.15,
                                        504.0,
                                        417.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "show that using such a vector representation maintains equivalent semantics. Further, we demonstrate"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        417.91,
                                        504.0,
                                        427.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "that the vector representation can easily be incorporated into the ACP algorithm to obtain a more"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        428.89,
                                        408.26,
                                        438.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "compact representation, which we also confirm in our empirical evaluation."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        445.34,
                                        504.0,
                                        455.23
                                    ],
                                    "text": "The remaining part of this paper is structured as follows. First, we provide the necessary background"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        456.14,
                                        504.0,
                                        466.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "information and introduce notations. We begin to recap FGs and afterwards formalise the problem"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        467.02,
                                        504.0,
                                        477.09
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of detecting exchangeable factors. Thereafter, we take a closer look at the problem of detecting"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        478.09,
                                        504.0,
                                        487.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exchangeable factors independent of the scale of their potentials and present our approach that makes"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        488.84,
                                        504.0,
                                        498.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "use of vector representations of potentials to solve this problem. We then embed the vectorised"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        499.75,
                                        504.0,
                                        509.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "approach into the framework of the ACP algorithm to obtain a generalisation of ACP, which we"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        510.74,
                                        435.53,
                                        520.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "evaluate empirically to demonstrate its practical effectiveness before we conclude."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        540.43,
                                        113.98,
                                        552.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        125.93,
                                        540.43,
                                        188.83,
                                        552.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Background"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.53,
                                        559.75,
                                        504.0,
                                        569.71
                                    ],
                                    "text": "We begin by defining FGs as propositional probabilistic graphical models. An FG compactly encodes"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        570.66,
                                        504.0,
                                        580.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a full joint probability distribution over a set of randvars by factorising the distribution into a product"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        581.56,
                                        325.22,
                                        591.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of factors (Frey et al., 1997; Kschischang et al., 2001)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        593.82,
                                        504.0,
                                        604.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Definition 1 (Factor Graph). An FG G = (V , E) is an undirected bipartite graph consisting of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        604.73,
                                        504.0,
                                        618.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a node set V = R ∪Φ, where R = {R1, . . . , Rn} is a set of variable nodes (randvars) and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.59,
                                        615.63,
                                        504.0,
                                        628.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Φ = {ϕ1, . . . , ϕm} is a set of factor nodes (functions), as well as a set of edges E ⊆R × Φ. The"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        626.54,
                                        504.0,
                                        637.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "term range(Ri) denotes the possible values of a randvar Ri. There is an edge between a variable"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        637.57,
                                        504.0,
                                        650.75
                                    ],
                                    "text": "node Ri and a factor node ϕj in E if Ri appears in the argument list of ϕj. The argument list Aj of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        648.44,
                                        504.0,
                                        661.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a factor ϕj(Aj) is a sequence of randvars from R. A factor is a function that maps its arguments to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        659.35,
                                        391.68,
                                        669.55
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a positive real number, called potential. The semantics of G is given by"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        262.9,
                                        684.79,
                                        291.74,
                                        696.25
                                    ],
                                    "text": "PG = "
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        291.74,
                                        678.05,
                                        296.73,
                                        688.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        290.48,
                                        691.62,
                                        297.27,
                                        701.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Z"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        304.21,
                                        674.58,
                                        311.27,
                                        681.55
                                    ],
                                    "text": "m"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        301.38,
                                        680.74,
                                        314.1,
                                        690.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Y"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        300.85,
                                        698.78,
                                        314.63,
                                        705.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "j=1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        316.29,
                                        684.79,
                                        349.09,
                                        697.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕj(Aj),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        493.05,
                                        684.62,
                                        504.67,
                                        694.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(1)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.29,
                                        505.75,
                                        725.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "where Z is the normalisation constant and Aj denotes the randvars occurring in ϕj’s argument list."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.76,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.24,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },

                                },

                                        103.66
                                    ],

                                },

                                        74.77,
                                        301.7,
                                        85.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        223.69,
                                        80.32,
                                        233.59,
                                        93.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ11"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        384.39,
                                        80.32,
                                        394.3,
                                        93.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ21"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        207.14,
                                        124.98,
                                        250.66,
                                        134.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Sick.alice"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        371.56,
                                        124.98,
                                        407.64,
                                        134.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Sick.bob"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        277.04,
                                        110.63,
                                        286.95,
                                        123.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ12"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        289.75,
                                        156.51,
                                        299.66,
                                        169.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ22"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        336.3,
                                        110.63,
                                        346.2,
                                        123.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ32"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        323.59,
                                        156.51,
                                        333.49,
                                        169.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ42"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        153.91,
                                        105.11,
                                        207.74,
                                        115.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Travel.alice"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        410.75,
                                        105.11,
                                        457.14,
                                        115.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Travel.bob"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        157.84,
                                        147.33,
                                        222.39,
                                        158.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat.alice.m1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        217.06,
                                        171.16,
                                        281.6,
                                        181.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat.alice.m2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        391.88,
                                        147.33,
                                        448.99,
                                        158.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat.bob.m1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        340.1,
                                        171.16,
                                        397.21,
                                        181.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat.bob.m2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        120.65,
                                        115.42,
                                        130.55,
                                        128.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ13"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        478.46,
                                        115.42,
                                        488.36,
                                        128.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ23"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        300.62,
                                        193.1,
                                        311.08,
                                        202.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(a)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        304.49,
                                        228.39,
                                        326.05,
                                        238.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Epid"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        297.54,
                                        259.99,
                                        332.99,
                                        269.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Sick(P)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.66,
                                        259.99,
                                        262.42,
                                        269.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Travel(P)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        370.05,
                                        259.99,
                                        425.12,
                                        269.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat(P, M)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        297.83,
                                        209.46,
                                        307.73,
                                        220.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        219.26,
                                        228.94,
                                        229.17,
                                        239.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        407.46,
                                        228.94,
                                        417.36,
                                        239.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        171.4,
                                        259.99,
                                        181.31,
                                        270.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        300.37,
                                        283.25,
                                        311.33,
                                        292.21
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(b)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        301.81,
                                        504.0,
                                        312.04
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figure 1: (a) An FG encoding a full joint probability distribution for an epidemic example (Hoffmann"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        312.65,
                                        504.0,
                                        322.71
                                    ],
                                    "text": "et al., 2022), (b) a PFG corresponding to the lifted representation of the FG shown in Fig. 1a. The"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        323.63,
                                        425.61,
                                        333.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "mappings of argument values to potentials of the factors are omitted for brevity."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        358.7,
                                        504.0,
                                        369.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 1. Figure 1a shows an FG for an epidemic example. The FG consists of two people (alice"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        369.53,
                                        504.0,
                                        381.08
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and bob) as well as two possible medications (m1 and m2) for treatment. For each person, there"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        380.49,
                                        504.0,
                                        390.71
                                    ],
                                    "text": "are two Boolean randvars (that is, randvars having a Boolean range) Sick and Travel, indicating"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        391.35,
                                        504.0,
                                        401.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "whether the person is sick and travels, respectively. Moreover, there is another Boolean randvar"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        402.38,
                                        504.0,
                                        412.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Treat for each combination of person and medication, specifying whether the person is treated with"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        413.24,
                                        435.41,
                                        423.44
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the medication. The Boolean randvar Epid states whether an epidemic is present."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        431.17,
                                        504.0,
                                        441.15
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted inference algorithms exploit symmetries in FGs to allow for tractable probabilistic inference"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        442.02,
                                        505.65,
                                        452.08
                                    ],
                                    "text": "with respect to domain sizes of logical variables. In a lifted representation such as a PFG, parame-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        452.93,
                                        505.24,
                                        462.99
                                    ],
                                    "text": "terised randvars and parametric factors represent sets of randvars and factors, respectively (Poole,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        463.84,
                                        504.34,
                                        473.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2003). Symmetries in FGs frequently occur in relational models and are highly relevant in many"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        474.75,
                                        504.34,
                                        484.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "real world domains. For example, in the epidemic domain, each person influences the probability"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        485.65,
                                        504.0,
                                        495.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of an epidemic in the same way—that is, the probability of having an epidemic depends on the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        496.7,
                                        504.0,
                                        506.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "number of sick people and not on individual people being sick. In other words, the probability for an"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        507.58,
                                        504.0,
                                        517.5
                                    ],
                                    "text": "epidemic is the same if there is a single sick person and the remaining people in the universe are not"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        518.43,
                                        504.17,
                                        528.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "sick, independent of whether alice or bob is sick. Analogously, there are symmetries in many other"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        529.29,
                                        504.0,
                                        539.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "domains, e.g., for movies the popularity of an actor influences the success of a movie in the same"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        540.28,
                                        322.36,
                                        550.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "way for each actor being part of the movie, and so on."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        552.52,
                                        504.0,
                                        562.95
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 2. A PFG corresponding to the lifted representation of the FG illustrated in Fig. 1a is"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        563.43,
                                        504.0,
                                        576.73
                                    ],
                                    "text": "shown in Fig. 1b. Here, two logical variables P and M with domains dom(P) = {alice, bob}"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        574.34,
                                        504.0,
                                        587.64
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and dom(M) = {m1, m2} are introduced to represent groups of indistinguishable people and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        585.36,
                                        505.74,
                                        595.28
                                    ],
                                    "text": "medications, respectively. Further, there are parametric factors that represent groups of factors, e.g.,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        595.1,
                                        504.0,
                                        608.67
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ1 represents ϕ11 and ϕ21. The underlying assumption is that ϕ11 and ϕ21 are exchangeable and hence"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        607.11,
                                        504.0,
                                        617.12
                                    ],
                                    "text": "encode equivalent semantics. By using logical variables in parameterised randvars, the number of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        618.07,
                                        504.0,
                                        628.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "parameterised randvars and parametric factors in the graph remains constant even if the number of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        628.96,
                                        244.88,
                                        638.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "people and medications increases."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        646.91,
                                        504.0,
                                        656.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "To detect symmetries in an FG and obtain a PFG for lifted inference, the ACP algorithm (Luttermann"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        657.79,
                                        504.0,
                                        667.79
                                    ],
                                    "text": "et al., 2024c) is the current state of the art. The ACP algorithm employs a colour passing routine to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        668.71,
                                        504.0,
                                        678.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "identify symmetric subgraphs and transforms a given FG into a PFG entailing equivalent semantics"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        679.56,
                                        504.0,
                                        689.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "as the initial FG. A formal description of the ACP algorithm is given in Appendix B. For now, it"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        690.47,
                                        504.0,
                                        700.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "is important to understand that ACP has to detect exchangeable factors during the course of the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        701.47,
                                        504.0,
                                        711.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "algorithm. Exchangeable factors are factors that encode equivalent semantics and play a crucial role"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        712.36,
                                        504.0,
                                        722.32
                                    ],
                                    "text": "when detecting and exploiting symmetries in an FG. In the next section, we investigate the problem"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.76,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.24,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],

                            "width": 612.0
                        }

                                },
                                {

                                    ],

                                },
                                {

                                    ],

                                    ],

                                },

                                    ],

                                        157.62,
                                        469.95,
                                        170.61
                                    ],

                                },

                                    ],

                                    ],

                                },
                                {

                                        445.86,
                                        168.53,
                                        469.95,
                                        181.52
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α · φ3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        377.86,
                                        179.27,
                                        396.57,
                                        189.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "false"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        408.53,
                                        179.27,
                                        427.24,
                                        189.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "false"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        445.86,
                                        179.44,
                                        469.95,
                                        192.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α · φ4"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        396.66,
                                        199.84,
                                        407.61,
                                        208.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(b)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        218.39,
                                        504.0,
                                        228.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figure 2: (a) An exemplary FG, (b) another FG encoding equivalent semantics as the FG shown in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        228.11,
                                        410.41,
                                        242.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(a) but containing a factor ϕ2 whose potentials are scaled by factor α ∈R+."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        264.93,
                                        504.0,
                                        275.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of detecting exchangeable factors in FGs independent of the scale of their potentials in detail and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        275.92,
                                        284.99,
                                        285.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "provide an efficient solution to this problem."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        305.89,
                                        113.98,
                                        317.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        125.93,
                                        305.89,
                                        426.5,
                                        317.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Avoiding Normalisation During Lifted Model Construction"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        325.26,
                                        504.0,
                                        335.33
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Before we formally define the notion of exchangeable factors, let us take a look at the upcoming"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        336.25,
                                        497.83,
                                        346.21
                                    ],
                                    "text": "example, which illustrates the idea of having differently scaled potentials in exchangeable factors."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        348.81,
                                        505.66,
                                        359.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 3. Consider again the FG depicted in Fig. 1a and let us assume we want to learn the po-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        359.83,
                                        504.0,
                                        369.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "tentials of the factors from observed data (e.g., by counting the occurrences of combinations of range"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        369.53,
                                        505.74,
                                        382.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "values). For example, to obtain the potentials for the factor ϕ11(Travel.alice, Sick.alice, Epid),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        381.66,
                                        505.65,
                                        391.78
                                    ],
                                    "text": "occurrences of alice becoming sick when travelling are counted. Analogously, occurrences of bob be-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        391.35,
                                        505.74,
                                        404.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "coming sick when travelling are counted to obtain the potentials of ϕ21(Travel.bob, Sick.bob, Epid)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.83,
                                        403.42,
                                        504.0,
                                        413.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "If both factors encode equivalent potentials, they can be grouped (as in Fig. 1b). Now, assume alice"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        414.34,
                                        505.74,
                                        424.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "travels twice as much as bob and both become sick on every second trip on average. In consequence,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        425.22,
                                        504.0,
                                        435.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "alice and bob “behave identically” with respect to becoming sick when travelling but the potentials"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        434.99,
                                        504.0,
                                        448.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of ϕ11 and ϕ21 lie on a different scale—in this particular example, the potentials of ϕ11 are equal to the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        445.9,
                                        393.33,
                                        459.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potentials of ϕ21 times two (because alice travels twice as much as bob)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        465.18,
                                        505.74,
                                        475.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "A straightforward solution to deal with different scales of potentials is to normalise potentials."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        476.16,
                                        504.0,
                                        486.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "However, we cannot always assume that a given FG contains normalised potentials by default and in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        487.03,
                                        504.0,
                                        497.05
                                    ],
                                    "text": "practical applications, the normalisation of potentials is often undesirable as it results in additional"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        498.01,
                                        504.0,
                                        507.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "floating point arithmetics causing numerical issues. We thus develop a solution that does not require"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        508.89,
                                        493.39,
                                        518.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potentials to be normalised but still detects exchangeable factors, which we formally define next."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        521.49,
                                        504.0,
                                        533.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Definition 2 (Exchangeable Factors). Let ϕ1(R1, . . . , Rn) and ϕ2(R′1, . . . , R′n) denote two factors"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        532.33,
                                        504.0,
                                        543.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "in an FG G. Then, ϕ1 and ϕ2 represent equivalent potentials if and only if there exists a scalar"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        539.62,
                                        504.0,
                                        558.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α ∈R+ and a permutation π of {1, . . . , n} such that for all r1, . . . , rn ∈×ni=1range(Ri) it holds"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        554.14,
                                        504.0,
                                        567.44
                                    ],
                                    "text": "that ϕ1(r1, . . . , rn) = α · ϕ2(rπ(1), . . . , rπ(n)). Factors that represent equivalent potentials are"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        565.13,
                                        221.16,
                                        575.16
                                    ],
                                    "text": "called exchangeable factors."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        583.28,
                                        504.0,
                                        593.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Note that as a necessary condition, exchangeable factors must be defined over the same function"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        594.26,
                                        350.96,
                                        604.23
                                    ],
                                    "text": "domain and hence must have the same number of arguments."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        606.79,
                                        504.0,
                                        618.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 4. Take a look at the FG depicted in Fig. 2a, which features two factors ϕ1 and ϕ2 that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        616.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        632.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "map to the exact same potential values φi ∈R+, i ∈{1, . . . , 4}. In this scenario, both tables of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        628.63,
                                        504.0,
                                        638.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "mappings from assignments of arguments to potential values are identical (i.e., α = 1 and π is the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        639.67,
                                        504.0,
                                        651.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "identity function) and hence, it is easy to tell that ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable. If we now consider the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.39,
                                        649.37,
                                        505.74,
                                        663.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "FG shown in Fig. 2b, we can observe that the potential values of ϕ2 are scaled by a factor α ∈R+."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        661.41,
                                        457.21,
                                        672.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Despite the scaling, ϕ1 and ϕ2 encode equivalent semantics and thus are exchangeable."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.53,
                                        679.64,
                                        504.0,
