                                        689.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "We remark that in general, π does not have to be the identity function, i.e., there might be situations"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        690.5,
                                        504.0,
                                        702.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "where, for example, the argument positions of C and B in ϕ2 are swapped and the potential values"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        701.47,
                                        504.0,
                                        712.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "in the table read φ1, φ3, φ2, φ4 from top to bottom instead of φ1, φ2, φ3, φ4. Note that the potential"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.28,
                                        504.17,
                                        722.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "mappings are still the same but their order is a different one. For now, we focus on the scalar"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.6,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.09,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "4"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 4,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        74.25,
                                        504.0,
                                        84.45
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α and assume that π is the identity function, that is, the arguments are already ordered such that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        85.16,
                                        504.0,
                                        95.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exchangeable arguments are located at the same argument positions if there are any exchangeable"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        96.2,
                                        505.71,
                                        106.09
                                    ],
                                    "text": "arguments. Later on, in Sec. 3.2, we also show how to deal with arbitrary permutations of arguments."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        112.45,
                                        505.25,
                                        122.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "A fundamental insight is that factors, whose potential mappings are equivalent up to a scalar α,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        123.29,
                                        504.17,
                                        133.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "are semantically equivalent. The intuition here is that the ratio of the potentials within a factor"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        134.27,
                                        504.17,
                                        144.33
                                    ],
                                    "text": "is the relevant part for the semantics of the factor whereas the absolute values no not matter. For"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        145.26,
                                        504.17,
                                        155.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "example, think of a factor ϕ that has two mappings in total, one for the assignment true and one for"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        156.09,
                                        504.17,
                                        166.3
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the assignment false. Semantically, it does not matter whether ϕ maps true to 1 and false to 2 or"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        167.03,
                                        504.0,
                                        177.21
                                    ],
                                    "text": "true to 2 and false to 4 because in both cases, ϕ weights the assignment false twice as much as the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        177.99,
                                        504.35,
                                        188.11
                                    ],
                                    "text": "assignment true. The normalisation constant Z in Eq. (1) ensures that in both cases, the probability"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        188.89,
                                        433.71,
                                        199.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "for true is 1/3 and the probability for false is 2/3. We next formalise this insight."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        202.05,
                                        504.0,
                                        215.27
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Theorem 1. Let G = (V , E) denote an FG with V = R ∪Φ, where R = {R1, . . . , Rn} is a set of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        212.88,
                                        504.0,
                                        227.67
                                    ],
                                    "text": "randvars and Φ = {ϕ1, . . . , ϕm} is a set of factors. Then, scaling any factor ϕk ∈Φ by a scalar"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        220.25,
                                        293.24,
                                        237.09
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α ∈R+ leaves the semantics of G unchanged."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        246.78,
                                        503.09,
                                        262.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Proof. Recall that the semantics of G (before scaling) is given by PG = 1ZQmj=1 ϕj(Aj), where Aj"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        261.64,
                                        503.2,
                                        272.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "denotes the randvars occurring in ϕj’s argument list and Z is the normalisation constant, defined as"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        227.41,
                                        289.72,
                                        245.43,
                                        299.68
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Z ="
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        272.35,
                                        285.66,
                                        286.74,
                                        295.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "X"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        248.21,
                                        303.42,
                                        310.89,
                                        313.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a∈×ni=1range(Ri)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        315.91,
                                        279.5,
                                        322.97,
                                        286.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "m"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        313.08,
                                        285.66,
                                        325.8,
                                        295.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Y"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        312.55,
                                        303.71,
                                        326.33,
                                        310.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "j=1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        328.0,
                                        289.72,
                                        384.58,
                                        302.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕj(Aj = aj),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        493.05,
                                        289.55,
                                        504.67,
                                        299.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(2)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        320.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        333.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "where aj denotes the assigned values to arguments Aj according to the assignment a. Now, assume"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        332.79,
                                        149.25,
                                        347.52
                                    ],
                                    "text": "that ϕk ∈"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        154.16,
                                        332.79,
                                        236.19,
                                        346.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Φ is scaled by α ∈"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        241.09,
                                        331.66,
                                        381.72,
                                        344.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "R+. Then, PG changes to PG ="
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        388.8,
                                        331.36,
                                        392.76,
                                        338.33
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        387.82,
                                        330.27,
                                        503.28,
                                        349.46
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Z · α · Qmj=1 ϕj(Aj) and Z"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        343.62,
                                        503.99,
                                        361.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "changes to Z = α · Pa∈×ni=1range(Ri)Qmj=1 ϕj(Aj = aj). In consequence, it holds that PG ="
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        113.94,
                                        359.38,
                                        117.91,
                                        366.36
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        109.2,
                                        358.3,
                                        476.67,
                                        377.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α·Z · α · Qmj=1 ϕj(Aj), which is equivalent to the original definition of PG as α cancels out."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        387.6,
                                        504.0,
                                        397.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Theorem 1 implies that it is also possible to scale various factors by different scalars without changing"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        398.39,
                                        504.17,
                                        408.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the semantics of the underlying model. Using this insight, it becomes clear that FGs can be further"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        409.4,
                                        504.36,
                                        419.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "compressed by taking into account factors that are exchangeable up to a scalar α. We next show how"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        420.25,
                                        442.48,
                                        430.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exchangeable factors can efficiently be detected independent of the scaling factor α."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        445.54,
                                        120.45,
                                        455.5
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3.1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        130.42,
                                        445.54,
                                        258.9,
                                        455.5
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Dealing with Scaled Potentials"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        463.74,
                                        504.0,
                                        473.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Previous work by Gehrke et al. (2020) shows that potentials of factors can be conceived as vectors"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        474.78,
                                        505.24,
                                        484.64
                                    ],
                                    "text": "such that the cosine similarity of the vectors can be used to check whether factors “behave identically”,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        485.59,
                                        504.0,
                                        495.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "thereby avoiding groundings in temporal probabilistic inference. We apply the idea of representing"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        496.6,
                                        504.0,
                                        506.46
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potentials as vectors to detect exchangeable factors independent of a scaling factor already during the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        507.43,
                                        491.53,
                                        517.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "construction of a PFG to obtain a more compact model even before online inference takes place."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        520.5,
                                        504.17,
                                        531.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Definition 3 (Vector Representation of Factors). Let ϕ(R1, . . . , Rn) denote a factor. The vector"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        531.42,
                                        392.02,
                                        547.15
                                    ],
                                    "text": "representation of ϕ is defined as the vector ⃗ϕ = (ϕ(a))a∈×ni=1range(Ri)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        548.04,
                                        504.29,
                                        559.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 5. Consider the factors ϕ1 and ϕ2 depicted in Fig. 2b. The vector representations of ϕ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        558.5,
                                        466.73,
                                        572.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and ϕ2 are given by ⃗ϕ1 = (φ1, φ2, φ3, φ4) and ⃗ϕ2 = (αφ1, αφ2, αφ3, αφ4), respectively."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        579.69,
                                        504.0,
                                        589.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Given a vector representation of a factor, the idea is that vectors of exchangeable factors point to the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        590.58,
                                        505.66,
                                        600.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "same direction in the vector space. Thus, the angle between those vectors can be computed to deter-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        601.53,
                                        504.0,
                                        611.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "mine whether the factors are exchangeable because exchangeable factors have vector representations"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        612.39,
                                        494.75,
                                        622.36
                                    ],
                                    "text": "whose angle is equal to zero (i.e., they are collinear). The upcoming example illustrates this idea."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        625.14,
                                        505.74,
                                        639.23
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 6. Take a look at Fig. 3, which shows the vector representations ⃗ϕ1 = (8, 2), ⃗ϕ2 = (4, 1),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        638.38,
                                        503.99,
                                        652.46
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⃗ϕ3 = (2, 2), and ⃗ϕ4 = (4.4, 3.6) for exemplary factors ϕ1, . . . , ϕ4. To allow for a two-dimensional"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        651.6,
                                        504.0,
                                        661.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "visualisation, every factor has two possible assignments (e.g., due to having a single Boolean"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        662.07,
                                        504.0,
                                        675.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "argument). The angle between ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ2 is exactly zero, indicating that ϕ1 and ϕ2 are collinear and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        675.4,
                                        504.0,
                                        688.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "hence exchangeable, which can be verified as ϕ1(a) = 2 · ϕ2(a) holds for all assignments a. At the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        686.21,
                                        504.0,
                                        700.04
                                    ],
                                    "text": "same time, the angle between, e.g., ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ3 is much larger than zero, indicating that ϕ1 and ϕ3 are"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        698.99,
                                        504.0,
                                        712.83
                                    ],
                                    "text": "not exchangeable. Further, observe that the angle between ⃗ϕ3 and ⃗ϕ4 is not exactly zero but close to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.29,
                                        427.04,
                                        723.75
                                    ],
                                    "text": "zero, indicating that ϕ3 and ϕ4 are not equivalent but approximately equivalent."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.76,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.24,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "5"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 5,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        232.96,
                                        159.87,
                                        237.94,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        247.13,
                                        159.87,
                                        252.11,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        261.3,
                                        159.87,
                                        266.29,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        275.48,
                                        159.87,
                                        280.46,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        289.65,
                                        159.87,
                                        294.63,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "4"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.82,
                                        159.87,
                                        308.8,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "5"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        318.0,
                                        159.87,
                                        322.98,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "6"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        332.17,
                                        159.6,
                                        337.15,
                                        169.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "7"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        346.34,
                                        159.87,
                                        351.32,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "8"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        360.52,
                                        159.87,
                                        382.16,
                                        169.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "9 10"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        150.09,
                                        229.09,
                                        160.05
                                    ],
                                    "text": "0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        135.97,
                                        229.09,
                                        145.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        121.8,
                                        229.09,
                                        131.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        107.57,
                                        229.09,
                                        117.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        93.45,
                                        229.09,
                                        103.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "4"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        224.11,
                                        79.23,
                                        229.09,
                                        89.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "5"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        343.63,
                                        110.5,
                                        353.54,
                                        123.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⃗ϕ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        286.94,
                                        124.67,
                                        296.84,
                                        138.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⃗ϕ2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        258.59,
                                        110.5,
                                        268.5,
                                        123.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⃗ϕ3"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        292.61,
                                        87.82,
                                        302.51,
                                        101.16
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⃗ϕ4"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        255.26,
                                        139.2,
                                        259.93,
                                        149.16
                                    ],
                                    "text": "θ"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        176.95,
                                        505.25,
                                        187.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figure 3: Vector representations for exemplary factors ϕ1, . . . , ϕ4. For the sake of this example,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        188.01,
                                        504.0,
                                        197.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "every factor maps two possible assignments to a potential value each. The mappings of the factors are"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        198.37,
                                        504.0,
                                        212.46
                                    ],
                                    "text": "encoded as vectors and are given by ⃗ϕ1 = (8, 2) (i.e., ϕ1 maps its first assignment to potential value"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        211.61,
                                        491.51,
                                        225.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "8 and the second assignment to potential value 2), ⃗ϕ2 = (4, 1), ⃗ϕ3 = (2, 2), and ⃗ϕ4 = (4.4, 3.6)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        250.51,
                                        504.0,
                                        260.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "By using vector representations and the cosine similarity between them, exchangeable factors can"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        261.57,
                                        504.0,
                                        271.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "efficiently be detected in practice. The cosine similarity between two vector representations of factors"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        272.48,
                                        504.0,
                                        282.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "lies within the interval [0, 1] and reaches its maximum value of one if the angle between the vectors is"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        283.38,
                                        500.85,
                                        293.26
                                    ],
                                    "text": "zero. To obtain a distance measure, we define the cosine distance as one minus the cosine similarity."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        296.4,
                                        504.0,
                                        308.25
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Definition 4 (Cosine Distance, Gehrke et al., 2020). Let ϕ1(R1, . . . , Rn) and ϕ2(R′1, . . . , R′n) denote"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        307.24,
                                        366.18,
                                        318.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "two factors. The cosine distance between ϕ1 and ϕ2 is defined as"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        155.17,
                                        341.86,
                                        235.79,
                                        354.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = 1 −"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        311.89,
                                        323.26,
                                        322.4,
                                        333.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "P"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        285.81,
                                        336.04,
                                        348.49,
                                        346.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a∈×ni=1range(Ri)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        350.15,
                                        325.32,
                                        406.26,
                                        338.3
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ1(a) · ϕ2(a)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        239.21,
                                        346.97,
                                        249.17,
                                        356.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "r"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        275.25,
                                        348.91,
                                        285.76,
                                        358.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "P"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        249.17,
                                        361.69,
                                        311.85,
                                        371.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a∈×ni=1range(Ri)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        313.51,
                                        346.97,
                                        359.6,
                                        363.96
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ1(a)2 ·r"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        385.68,
                                        348.91,
                                        396.19,
                                        358.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "P"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        359.6,
                                        361.69,
                                        422.28,
                                        371.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "a∈×ni=1range(R′i)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        423.94,
                                        348.09,
                                        454.06,
                                        361.68
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ2(a)2 "
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        454.06,
                                        341.86,
                                        456.82,
                                        351.82
                                    ],
                                    "text": "."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        493.05,
                                        341.69,
                                        504.67,
                                        351.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(3)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.83,
                                        380.64,
                                        453.97,
                                        393.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "If ϕ1 and ϕ2 are defined over different function domains, we define Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = ∞."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        399.2,
                                        504.0,
                                        409.26
                                    ],
                                    "text": "A fundamental advantage of using vector representations in combination with the cosine distance"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        410.11,
                                        503.5,
                                        421.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "to search for exchangeable factors is that it is also possible to allow for a small deviation of Dcos"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        421.08,
                                        504.0,
                                        431.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "from zero (e.g., dependent on a hyperparameter ε). While it is also conceivable to directly compare"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        431.93,
                                        504.0,
                                        442.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the tables of potential mappings and allowing for a deviation controlled by ε, a direct comparison"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        442.83,
                                        504.0,
                                        453.04
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of tables becomes sophisticated in settings where both a deviation and a scaling factor α have to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        453.74,
                                        504.0,
                                        463.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "be considered at the same time. Vector representations circumvent such issues and allow for a"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        464.81,
                                        504.0,
                                        474.67
                                    ],
                                    "text": "straightforward comparison of factors at any time. In this paper, however, we focus on the problem of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        475.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        485.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exact lifted model construction, i.e., we aim to transform a given FG into a PFG entailing equivalent"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        486.55,
                                        504.0,
                                        496.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "semantics as the initial FG. Allowing for a deviation between potentials results in the problem setup"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        497.47,
                                        505.65,
                                        507.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of approximate lifted model construction, which is a different problem not considered in detail here."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        513.77,
                                        504.0,
                                        523.83
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Before we continue to deal with permutations of arguments in addition to scaled potentials, we"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        524.75,
                                        463.33,
                                        534.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "formally show that the cosine distance is a suitable measure to check for exchangeability."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        537.69,
                                        505.65,
                                        549.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Theorem 2. Let ϕ1(R1, . . . , Rn) and ϕ2(R′1, . . . , R′n) denote two factors. If ϕ1 and ϕ2 are ex-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        548.68,
                                        301.47,
                                        559.62
                                    ],
                                    "text": "changeable, then it holds that Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = 0."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        573.22,
                                        399.02,
                                        586.45
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Proof Sketch. If ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable, there exists a scalar α ∈"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        403.09,
                                        569.61,
                                        503.64,
                                        584.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "R+ and a permutation π"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        584.13,
                                        289.48,
                                        598.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of {1, . . . , n} such that for all r1, . . . , rn ∈"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        294.31,
                                        587.4,
                                        302.05,
                                        597.36
                                    ],
                                    "text": "×"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        302.05,
                                        583.0,
                                        306.98,
                                        589.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "n"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        302.05,
                                        584.13,
                                        503.99,
                                        597.36
                                    ],
                                    "text": "i=1range(Ri) it holds that ϕ1(r1, . . . , rn) = α ·"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        595.2,
                                        504.0,
                                        606.55
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ2(rπ(1), . . . , rπ(n)). Without loss of generality, assume that the arguments of ϕ2 are rearranged such"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        605.92,
                                        505.24,
                                        621.78
                                    ],
                                    "text": "that for all r1, . . . , rn ∈×ni=1range(Ri) it holds that ϕ1(r1, . . . , rn) = α · ϕ2(r1, . . . , rn). Then,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        618.04,
                                        438.47,
                                        631.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "entering ϕ1(r1, . . . , rn) = α · ϕ2(r1, . . . , rn) into Eq. (3) yields Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = 0."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        642.45,
                                        504.0,
                                        656.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Note that the cosine distance is a measure to check for collinearity of the vectors ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ2, that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        655.35,
                                        504.17,
                                        670.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "is, to check whether there exists a scalar α such that ⃗ϕ1 = α · ⃗ϕ2. As we only have to check for"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        668.74,
                                        504.0,
                                        678.68
                                    ],
                                    "text": "collinearity, we can avoid computing the cosine distance (and hence avoid floating point arithmetics"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        679.71,
                                        504.0,
                                        689.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "during exchangeability checks) by checking the equality of products of potential values. The technical"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        690.62,
                                        505.24,
                                        700.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "details for collinearity checks using only multiplication operations are given in Appendix D. However,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        701.53,
                                        504.0,
                                        711.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "also keep in mind that even when using the cosine distance to determine collinearity of vectors (which"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.28,
                                        504.0,
                                        722.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "involves floating point arithmetics), we are able to avoid floating point numbers in the tables of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.76,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.24,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "6"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }

                                    "bbox": [
