                                        371.66,
                                        153.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "[0, 2]"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        391.33,
                                        143.61,
                                        410.06,
                                        156.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⟨φ4⟩"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        437.04,
                                        143.61,
                                        469.37,
                                        156.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⟨α · φ4⟩"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        199.4,
                                        505.65,
                                        209.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figure 4: An FG entailing equivalent semantics as the FGs shown in Figs. 2a and 2b with corre-"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        210.35,
                                        504.0,
                                        221.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "sponding buckets. Note that the arguments of the factor ϕ2 are arranged in a different order than in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        221.37,
                                        505.25,
                                        231.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figs. 2a and 2b as B appears at position one and C at position two, whereas in the previous examples,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        232.21,
                                        286.41,
                                        242.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "C was at position one and B at position two."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        267.31,
                                        504.0,
                                        277.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potential mappings of the factors, which is the more important place to avoid floating point arithmetics"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        278.14,
                                        389.05,
                                        288.11
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(because during probabilistic inference, these numbers are multiplied)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        294.6,
                                        505.74,
                                        304.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "So far, we did not pay attention to permutations of arguments when looking for exchangeable factors."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        305.37,
                                        504.0,
                                        315.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "In practice, however, we cannot assume that exchangeable arguments are always located at the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        316.36,
                                        504.0,
                                        326.31
                                    ],
                                    "text": "same argument position in their respective factors. Therefore, in the next section, we investigate the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        327.2,
                                        504.0,
                                        337.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "problem of detecting exchangeable factors independent of the scale of their potentials while at the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        338.17,
                                        396.7,
                                        348.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "same time taking arbitrary permutations of their arguments into account."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        362.26,
                                        120.45,
                                        372.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3.2"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        130.42,
                                        362.26,
                                        305.0,
                                        372.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Dealing with Permutations of Arguments"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        380.32,
                                        504.0,
                                        390.32
                                    ],
                                    "text": "A straightforward approach to handle permutations of arguments when searching for exchangeable"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        391.18,
                                        504.0,
                                        401.24
                                    ],
                                    "text": "factors is to iterate over all possible argument permutations of one of the factors, rearrange its"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        402.09,
                                        504.0,
                                        412.15
                                    ],
                                    "text": "arguments and its table of potential mappings accordingly, and then compute the cosine distance"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        413.0,
                                        504.0,
                                        423.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "as described in Sec. 3.1. If there exists a permutation such that the cosine distance is zero, the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        423.91,
                                        504.35,
                                        433.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "factors are exchangeable, otherwise they are not. Such an approach, however, is computationally"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        434.93,
                                        504.0,
                                        445.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "expensive as it iterates over O(n!) argument permutations for a factor with n arguments in the worst"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        445.69,
                                        505.25,
                                        455.78
                                    ],
                                    "text": "case. Luttermann et al. (2024d) introduce the detection of exchangeable factors (DEFT) algorithm,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        456.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        466.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "which avoids iterating over all permutations of arguments and thereby allows to efficiently detect"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        467.56,
                                        504.35,
                                        477.75
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exchangeable factors according to Def. 2 where α = 1. In other words, DEFT is able to efficiently"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        478.45,
                                        504.35,
                                        488.52
                                    ],
                                    "text": "handle permutations of arguments but does not consider differently scaled potentials. We now"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        489.44,
                                        504.0,
                                        499.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "combine the ideas of DEFT and the vector representation in combination with the cosine distance to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        500.35,
                                        450.3,
                                        510.31
                                    ],
                                    "text": "handle both scalars different from one and permutations of arguments simultaneously."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        516.72,
                                        504.0,
                                        526.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "The idea behind the DEFT algorithm is that a factor maps its arguments to potential values that can"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        527.5,
                                        504.0,
                                        537.63
                                    ],
                                    "text": "be distributed across so-called buckets. Buckets count the occurrences of specific range values in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        538.51,
                                        504.0,
                                        548.53
                                    ],
                                    "text": "an assignment for a subset of a factor’s arguments and within these buckets, possible permutations"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        549.44,
                                        504.0,
                                        559.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of arguments are heavily restricted such that not all permutations have to be considered. Before we"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        560.37,
                                        395.74,
                                        570.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "illustrate the idea at an example, we give a formal definition of a bucket."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        572.57,
                                        503.99,
                                        585.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Definition 5 (Bucket, Luttermann et al., 2024d). Let ϕ(R1, . . . , Rn) denote a factor and let S ⊆"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        583.48,
                                        504.0,
                                        596.78
                                    ],
                                    "text": "{R1, . . . , Rn} denote a subset of ϕ’s arguments such that range(Ri) = range(Rj) holds for all"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        594.49,
                                        504.0,
                                        609.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Ri, Rj ∈S. Further, let V denote the range of the elements in S (identical for all Ri ∈S). Then, a"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        606.89,
                                        504.0,
                                        624.33
                                    ],
                                    "text": "bucket b entailed by S is a set of tuples {(vi, ni)}|V|i=1, vi ∈V, ni ∈N, and Pi ni = |S|, such that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        619.59,
                                        505.74,
                                        631.09
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ni specifies the number of occurrences of potential value vi in an assignment for all randvars in S."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.39,
                                        632.45,
                                        505.16,
                                        646.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "A shorthand notation for {(vi, ni)}|V|i=1 is [n1, . . . , n|V|]. In abuse of notation, we denote by ϕ≻(b)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        643.92,
                                        504.0,
                                        654.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the ordered multiset of potentials a bucket b is mapped to by ϕ (in order of their appearance in ϕ’s"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        654.88,
                                        444.78,
                                        668.1
                                    ],
                                    "text": "table of potential mappings). The set of all buckets entailed by ϕ is denoted as B(ϕ)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        668.65,
                                        504.0,
                                        678.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 7. Take a look at Fig. 4, which displays an FG entailing equivalent semantics as the FGs"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        679.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        689.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "shown in Figs. 2a and 2b with corresponding buckets. In this example, B appears at position one and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        690.55,
                                        504.0,
                                        701.91
                                    ],
                                    "text": "C at position two in ϕ2 whereas in Figs. 2a and 2b, C was at position one and B at position two. Both"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        701.41,
                                        505.77,
                                        714.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ1 and ϕ2 entail three buckets {(true, 2), (false, 0)}, {(true, 1), (false, 1)}, {(true, 0), (false, 2)}—"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.37,
                                        505.74,
                                        722.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "or [2, 0], [1, 1], [0, 2] in shorthand notation. Every bucket corresponds to at least one assignment, e.g.,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.65,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.13,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "7"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 7,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        74.01,
                                        393.88,
                                        84.27
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Algorithm 1 Detection of Exchangeable Factors without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        125.43,
                                        88.04,
                                        359.64,
                                        99.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Input: Two factors ϕ1(R1, . . . , Rn) and ϕ2(R′1, . . . , R′m)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        125.43,
                                        98.95,
                                        347.65,
                                        110.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Output: true if ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable, else false."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        112.02,
                                        257.19,
                                        125.01
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1: if n = m ∨B(ϕ1) = B(ϕ2) then"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        123.53,
                                        119.95,
                                        132.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "2:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        122.93,
                                        188.86,
                                        133.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "return false"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        133.96,
                                        216.22,
                                        146.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3: for each b ∈B(ϕ1) do"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        380.38,
                                        133.79,
                                        501.22,
                                        146.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "▷It holds that B(ϕ1) = B(ϕ2)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        145.47,
                                        119.96,
                                        154.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "4:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        144.87,
                                        273.14,
                                        157.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α ←max(ϕ≻1 (b)) / max(ϕ≻2 (b))"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        156.37,
                                        119.96,
                                        165.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "5:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        155.61,
                                        321.51,
                                        165.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "if α differs from α for a previous bucket then"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        167.28,
                                        119.96,
                                        176.25
                                    ],
                                    "text": "6:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        154.82,
                                        166.69,
                                        203.8,
                                        176.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "return false"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        178.31,
                                        119.96,
                                        187.28
                                    ],
                                    "text": "7:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        177.55,
                                        342.56,
                                        192.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Cb ←Possible swaps to obtain ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        189.22,
                                        478.56,
                                        206.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "8: if there exists a swap of ϕ2’s arguments in Tb∈B(ϕ1) Cb such that Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = 0 then"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        112.98,
                                        204.07,
                                        119.96,
                                        213.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "9:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        203.47,
                                        187.45,
                                        213.55
                                    ],
                                    "text": "return true"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.5,
                                        214.5,
                                        140.43,
                                        224.46
                                    ],
                                    "text": "10: else"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.5,
                                        225.89,
                                        119.96,
                                        234.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "11:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        139.88,
                                        225.29,
                                        188.86,
                                        235.37
                                    ],
                                    "text": "return false"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        259.4,
                                        504.0,
                                        270.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the bucket [1, 1] corresponds to all assignments that contain one true and one false value. ϕ1 maps"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        270.32,
                                        313.27,
                                        283.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "[1, 1] to ⟨φ2, φ3⟩and ϕ2 maps [1, 1] to ⟨αφ3, αφ2⟩."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        288.83,
                                        504.67,
                                        300.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Luttermann et al. (2024d) show that two factors ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable (for the setting of α = 1)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        299.73,
                                        504.0,
                                        312.45
                                    ],
                                    "text": "if and only if there exists a permutation of their arguments such that ϕ≻1 (b) = ϕ≻2 (b) for all buckets b"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        310.57,
                                        504.17,
                                        322.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "entailed by the arguments of ϕ1 and ϕ2. The DEFT algorithm exploits this property by checking for"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        321.53,
                                        504.0,
                                        334.27
                                    ],
                                    "text": "each bucket b whether arguments can be rearranged such that ϕ≻1 (b) = ϕ≻2 (b) holds. The idea is that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        332.41,
                                        505.25,
                                        342.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the potential values in the ordered multisets determine possible permutations of arguments and thus,"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        343.22,
                                        504.0,
                                        353.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "DEFT avoids iterating over all permutations of arguments. For example, assuming that α = 1 in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        354.29,
                                        504.0,
                                        366.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Fig. 4, we know that αφ3 must be located at position one and αφ2 at position two in ϕ≻2 to match the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        365.04,
                                        505.25,
                                        377.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "order of ϕ≻1 . The corresponding assignments of αφ2, i.e., (false, true), and αφ3, i.e., (true, false),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        376.05,
                                        504.0,
                                        387.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "are then used to determine possible positions of arguments to achieve that αφ3 is located at position"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        386.86,
                                        504.0,
                                        399.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "one and αφ2 at position two in ϕ≻2 . For now, it is sufficient to understand that identical potential"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.75,
                                        397.85,
                                        504.0,
                                        410.45
                                    ],
                                    "text": "values in ϕ≻1 and ϕ≻2 must be found. Further technical details about the DEFT algorithm are given in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        408.76,
                                        504.0,
                                        418.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(Luttermann et al., 2024d). We next generalise the DEFT algorithm such that it is able to handle the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        419.74,
                                        504.0,
                                        432.82
                                    ],
                                    "text": "setting of α = 1 as well. A crucial observation is that the orders of the potential values in the ordered"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        430.57,
                                        319.64,
                                        440.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "multisets must be identical up to the scaling factor α."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.67,
                                        443.31,
                                        504.0,
                                        454.87
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Theorem 3. Let ϕ1 and ϕ2 denote two factors. Then, ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable if and only if"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        454.3,
                                        504.0,
                                        467.52
                                    ],
                                    "text": "there exists a permutation of their arguments such that ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b) for all buckets b entailed"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        465.19,
                                        504.0,
                                        478.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "by the arguments of ϕ1 and ϕ2, where, by abuse of notation, α · ϕ≻2 (b) denotes the ordered multiset"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        476.12,
                                        355.64,
                                        488.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "resulting from multiplying each potential value in ϕ≻2 (b) by α."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        499.47,
                                        504.0,
                                        511.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Proof. For the first direction, it holds that ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable. According to Def. 2, there"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        506.92,
                                        504.0,
                                        523.61
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exists a scalar α ∈R+ and a permutation of ϕ2’s arguments such that ϕ1 and ϕ2 have identical tables"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        521.29,
                                        504.0,
                                        531.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of potential mappings up to the scaling factor α. In consequence, for every bucket b it holds that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        532.44,
                                        120.16,
                                        542.4
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ≻"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        113.94,
                                        532.27,
                                        486.79,
                                        545.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b) since both tables read identical potential values up to α from top to bottom."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        548.58,
                                        504.0,
                                        561.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "For the second direction, it holds that ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b) for all buckets b. Converting the buckets"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        559.52,
                                        504.0,
                                        569.55
                                    ],
                                    "text": "back to tables of potential mappings then results in identical tables of potential mappings up to the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        570.48,
                                        335.1,
                                        581.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "scalar α, which implies that ϕ1 and ϕ2 are exchangeable."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        593.83,
                                        504.0,
                                        603.8
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Using the insight from Thm. 3, the DEFT algorithm can be adapted to search for identical potential"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.75,
                                        604.72,
                                        504.0,
                                        614.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "values up to scalar α in the ordered multisets of potential values, as shown in Alg. 1. To do so, α is"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        615.73,
                                        504.0,
                                        628.44
                                    ],
                                    "text": "determined first, which is done by computing α = max(ϕ≻1 (b)) / max(ϕ≻2 (b)) in bucket b. Note that"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        626.49,
                                        504.0,
                                        636.69
                                    ],
                                    "text": "α must be identical for every bucket b, otherwise the two factors cannot be exchangeable. Having"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        637.4,
                                        504.0,
                                        647.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "determined α, possible permutations of arguments are obtained by looking for identical potential"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.75,
                                        648.31,
                                        504.0,
                                        658.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "values up to scalar α. Possible permutations of arguments are then verified (or rejected) using the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        659.29,
                                        381.94,
                                        670.75
                                    ],
                                    "text": "cosine distance between ϕ1 and ϕ2 after rearranging ϕ2’s arguments."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        672.09,
                                        504.0,
                                        683.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Example 8. Consider again the factors ϕ1 and ϕ2 depicted in Fig. 4. Rearranging ϕ2’s arguments"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        682.99,
                                        504.0,
                                        693.96
                                    ],
                                    "text": "such that B is placed at position two and C at position one in ϕ2’s argument list yields the table of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        693.93,
                                        439.95,
                                        705.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potential mappings for ϕ2 depicted in Fig. 2b and thus results in Dcos(ϕ1, ϕ2) = 0."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.53,
                                        712.36,
                                        446.86,
                                        722.32
                                    ],
                                    "text": "We next demonstrate the practical effectiveness of Alg. 1 in our empirical evaluation."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        303.76,
                                        743.01,
                                        308.24,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "8"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,

                            "rects": [
                                {

                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {

                                        134.39,

                                        142.44,
                                        145.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "30"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        130.37,
                                        123.71,

                                        131.77
                                    ],

                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [

                                    "text": "300"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [

                                        104.74
                                    ],

                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [

                                        142.44,
                                        91.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "3000"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        151.53,
                                        154.43,
                                        155.55,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        180.96,
                                        154.43,
                                        193.04,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "250"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        214.42,
                                        154.43,
                                        226.5,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "500"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        247.89,
                                        154.43,
                                        259.97,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "750"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        279.34,
                                        154.43,
                                        295.44,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "1000"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        219.82,
                                        164.13,
                                        224.58,
                                        173.28
                                    ],
                                    "text": "d"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        115.03,
                                        128.9,
                                        124.18,
                                        131.44
                                    ],
                                    "text": "t"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        115.03,
                                        126.35,
                                        124.18,
                                        128.9
                                    ],
                                    "text": "i"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        115.03,
                                        119.23,
                                        124.18,
                                        126.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "m"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        115.03,
                                        115.17,

                                    "text": "e"
                                },

                                        124.18,
                                        102.72
                                    ],
