                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 14,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        73.14,
                                        116.63,
                                        85.1
                                    ],
                                    "text": "D"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        128.59,
                                        73.14,
                                        442.09,
                                        85.1
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Checking Collinearity of Vectors without Division Operations"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        93.67,
                                        504.0,
                                        107.75
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Let ⃗ϕ1 = (φ1, . . . , φn) and ⃗ϕ2 = (ψ1, . . . , ψn) denote two vector representations of factors ϕ1 and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        106.9,
                                        503.96,
                                        120.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ϕ2. Our goal is to check whether ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ2 are collinear, that is, whether there exists a scalar α"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        119.8,
                                        503.99,
                                        135.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "such that ⃗ϕ1 = α · ⃗ϕ2, without using division or square root operations. By doing so, we avoid"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        133.15,
                                        504.0,
                                        144.64
                                    ],
                                    "text": "floating point arithmetic issues. In particular, if the potential values φ1, . . . , φn and ψ1, . . . , ψn are"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        144.07,
                                        504.0,
                                        154.05
                                    ],
                                    "text": "integers (which is the case if the initial FG is learned from data by counting occurrences of specific"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        155.04,
                                        504.35,
                                        164.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "assignments), then no floating point numbers are involved in our calculations during exchangeability"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        165.93,
                                        504.0,
                                        175.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "checks. Note that, even if we apply the cosine distance to check for collinearity, the model itself can"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        176.82,
                                        504.0,
                                        186.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "still consist only of integer potential values and only the check for exchangeability involves floating"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        187.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        197.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "point arithmetics in this case (as opposed to a model where potential values are normalised at the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        198.63,
                                        405.36,
                                        208.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "beginning, which results in floating point numbers for its potential values)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.53,
                                        214.55,
                                        504.0,
                                        230.16
                                    ],
                                    "text": "We next provide the technical details to check whether ⃗ϕ1 = α · ⃗ϕ2 holds by using only multiplication"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        227.45,
                                        503.5,
                                        243.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "operations. If ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ2 are collinear, we have φ1 = α · ψ1, . . . , φn = α · ψn and hence α = φi / ψi"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        240.89,
                                        504.0,
                                        253.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "for all i ∈{1, . . . , n}. Since α = φi / ψi holds for all i ∈{1, . . . , n}, we can enter α = φ1 / ψ1 into"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        251.72,
                                        250.27,
                                        264.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the equation φi = α · ψi and obtain"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        294.51,
                                        275.38,
                                        318.82,
                                        286.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi = "
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        318.82,
                                        268.64,
                                        329.3,
                                        279.35
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        318.83,
                                        282.21,
                                        329.29,
                                        292.92
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ψ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        333.21,
                                        275.38,
                                        347.5,
                                        288.36
                                    ],
                                    "text": "· ψi"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        275.21,
                                        504.67,
                                        285.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(16)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        263.62,
                                        295.77,
                                        348.37,
                                        310.25
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⇔φi · ψ1 = φ1 · ψi."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        295.6,
                                        504.67,
                                        305.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(17)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        316.46,
                                        503.5,
                                        333.57
                                    ],
                                    "text": "In consequence, we can check whether ⃗ϕ1 and ⃗ϕ2 are collinear by verifying whether φi · ψ1 = φ1 · ψi"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        329.76,
                                        504.0,
                                        342.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "holds for all i ∈{1, . . . , n}. Verifying this equation involves only multiplication operations and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        340.74,
                                        345.86,
                                        350.71
                                    ],
                                    "text": "hence avoids floating point arithmetics as much as possible."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        357.05,
                                        504.0,
                                        367.12
                                    ],
                                    "text": "To supplement Sec. 3.2, we next show that the aforementioned approach can also be extended"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        367.96,
                                        504.0,
                                        381.19
                                    ],
                                    "text": "to handle permutations of arguments. In case there exists a permutation π of {1, . . . , n} such"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        377.74,
                                        505.25,
                                        393.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "that for all r1, . . . , rn ∈×ni=1range(Ri) it holds that ϕ1(r1, . . . , rn) = α · ϕ2(rπ(1), . . . , rπ(n)),"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        390.88,
                                        328.88,
                                        404.11
                                    ],
                                    "text": "it does not necessarily hold that α = φi / ψi for i ∈"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        333.12,
                                        390.88,
                                        503.99,
                                        404.11
                                    ],
                                    "text": "{1, . . . , n}. However, we know that α ="
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        401.79,
                                        504.0,
                                        415.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "maxi∈{1,...,n} φi / maxi∈{1,...,n} ψi (analogously for min instead of max). At the same time, we"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        412.7,
                                        504.0,
                                        422.76
                                    ],
                                    "text": "know that in the first bucket, there is only a single potential value, which remains the same for all"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        423.68,
                                        504.0,
                                        436.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "possible permutations π of {1, . . . , n} because the corresponding assignment assigns all arguments"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        434.52,
                                        504.0,
                                        446.22
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the same range value (e.g., true). We thus have α = φ1 / ψ1 again, regardless of the order of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        445.54,
                                        504.5,
                                        458.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "arguments. Consequently, when searching for possible swaps to obtain ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b) in Line 7"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        456.34,
                                        505.16,
                                        471.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of Alg. 1, we can find identical potential values up to the scalar α for each φi ∈ϕ≻1 (b) in ϕ≻2 (b)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        467.25,
                                        505.74,
                                        481.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "by iterating over all potential values ψi ∈ϕ≻2 (b) and checking whether φi · ψ1 = φ1 · ψi holds."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        478.16,
                                        504.0,
                                        491.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Having found identical potential values up to α, possible swaps to obtain ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b) are"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        489.15,
                                        505.75,
                                        499.27
                                    ],
                                    "text": "again determined by the positions of the identical potential values (up to α) in the ordered multisets."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        500.13,
                                        504.0,
                                        514.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "In particular, if φi = α · ψi holds for φi ∈ϕ≻1 (b) and ψi ∈ϕ≻2 (b), then φi and ψi must be located at"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        510.96,
                                        455.21,
                                        524.11
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the same position in ϕ≻1 (b) and ϕ≻2 (b), respectively, to achieve that ϕ≻1 (b) = α · ϕ≻2 (b)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        527.38,
                                        504.0,
                                        537.3
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Finally, we remark that this approach can be further extended to allow for a small deviation between"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        538.31,
                                        504.35,
                                        548.2
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potential values that are considered identical. More specifically, instead of requiring that the equality"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        549.24,
                                        504.0,
                                        562.32
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi = α · ψi holds for all i ∈{1, . . . , n}, we can allow for a small deviation of factor (1 + ε) between"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        560.15,
                                        504.0,
                                        574.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "potential values and require that φi ∈[α · ψi · (1−ε), α · ψi · (1+ ε)] holds for all i ∈{1, . . . , n}. To"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        571.05,
                                        505.38,
                                        582.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "check whether φi lies in the specified interval, we need to ensure that the following inequalities hold:"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        253.71,
                                        591.2,
                                        358.29,
                                        605.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi ≥α · ψi · (1 −ε), and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        591.2,
                                        504.67,
                                        601.16
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(18)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        253.71,
                                        605.26,
                                        339.75,
                                        619.74
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi ≤α · ψi · (1 + ε)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        605.1,
                                        504.67,
                                        615.06
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(19)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        625.31,
                                        345.27,
                                        636.93
                                    ],
                                    "text": "By entering α = φ1 / ψ1 into Eqs. (18) and (19), we obtain"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        242.34,
                                        645.52,
                                        369.66,
                                        660.17
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi · ψ1 ≥φ1 · ψi · (1 −ε), and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        645.52,
                                        504.67,
                                        655.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(20)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        242.34,
                                        659.59,
                                        351.11,
                                        674.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi · ψ1 ≤φ1 · ψi · (1 + ε)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        659.42,
                                        504.67,
                                        669.38
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(21)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        679.61,
                                        504.0,
                                        692.79
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Note that in general, it holds that ε ∈[0, 1] is a small floating point number. To avoid floating point"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        690.58,
                                        504.34,
                                        700.67
                                    ],
                                    "text": "arithmetics, we can restrict ε to be a rational number, which does not limit the practical applicability"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        701.38,
                                        504.0,
                                        714.6
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of this approach, as ε can still be chosen arbitrarily small (e.g., 1 / q for some arbitrary q ∈Z). In"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        712.28,
                                        504.0,
                                        725.51
                                    ],
                                    "text": "particular, if ε is a rational number, it can be represented by a fraction ε = p / q where p ∈Z and"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        301.18,
                                        743.01,
                                        310.15,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "15"
                                }
                            ],
                            "section": [],
                            "sub_section": [],
                            "type": "text",
                            "width": 612.0
                        }
                    },
                    {
                        "content": "",
                        "metadata": {
                            "chapter": [],
                            "height": 792.0,
                            "page": 15,
                            "rects": [
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        216.34,
                                        42.21,
                                        395.66,
                                        51.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Lifted Model Construction without Normalisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        130.37,
                                        128.83,
                                        138.42,
                                        136.88
                                    ],
                                    "text": "30"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        130.37,
                                        114.24,
                                        138.42,
                                        122.29
                                    ],
                                    "text": "50"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        126.34,
                                        94.44,
                                        138.42,
                                        102.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "100"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        147.68,
                                        154.43,
                                        151.7,
                                        162.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "0"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        178.01,
                                        154.43,
                                        190.08,

                                },
                                {

                                    ],
                                    "text": "β"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        183.72,
                                        504.0,
                                        194.04
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Figure 7: Average query times of lifted variable elimination run on the output of ACP and α-ACP"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        194.68,
                                        504.0,
                                        204.81
                                    ],
                                    "text": "where the input FGs contain a proportion of p = 0.01 scaled factors (left), and the distribution of the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        205.59,
                                        504.0,
                                        215.72
                                    ],
                                    "text": "number β of queries after which the offline overhead of α-ACP amortises on input FGs containing a"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        216.5,
                                        286.67,
                                        226.63
                                    ],
                                    "text": "proportion of p = 0.01 scaled factors (right)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        252.65,
                                        452.47,
                                        265.8
                                    ],
                                    "text": "q ∈Z are integers. Making use of this property, entering ε = p / q into Eq. (20) yields"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        201.51,
                                        270.7,
                                        229.0,
                                        285.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi · ψ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        322.83,
                                        270.7,
                                        398.08,
                                        285.18
                                    ],
                                    "text": "≥φ1 · ψi · (1 −ε)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        270.53,
                                        504.67,
                                        280.49
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(22)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        189.06,
                                        284.6,
                                        229.27,
                                        299.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⇔φi · ψ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        322.83,
                                        284.6,
                                        402.9,
                                        299.07
                                    ],
                                    "text": "≥φ1 · (ψi −ψi · ε)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        284.43,
                                        504.67,
                                        294.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(23)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        189.06,
                                        298.49,
                                        229.27,
                                        312.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⇔φi · ψ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        322.83,
                                        298.49,
                                        413.34,
                                        312.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "≥φ1 · ψi −φ1 · ψi · ε"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        298.33,
                                        504.67,
                                        308.29
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(24)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        189.06,
                                        316.78,
                                        229.28,
                                        331.26
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⇔φi · ψ1"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        322.83,
                                        316.78,
                                        409.89,
                                        331.26
                                    ],
                                    "text": "≥φ1 · ψi −φ1 · ψi · "
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        409.89,
                                        310.04,
                                        414.9,
                                        320.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "p"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        410.0,
                                        323.61,
                                        414.44,
                                        333.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "q"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        316.61,
                                        504.67,
                                        326.58
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(25)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        189.06,
                                        337.17,
                                        241.41,
                                        351.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "⇔φi · ψ1 · q"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        322.83,
                                        337.17,
                                        425.71,
                                        351.65
                                    ],
                                    "text": "≥φ1 · ψi · q −φ1 · ψi · p"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        337.01,
                                        504.67,
                                        346.97
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(26)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        354.89,
                                        253.53,
                                        364.85
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and analogously for Eq. (21), we get"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        231.8,
                                        372.94,
                                        380.19,
                                        387.42
                                    ],
                                    "text": "φi · ψ1 · q ≤φ1 · ψi · q + φ1 · ψi · p."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        488.07,
                                        372.77,
                                        504.67,
                                        382.73
                                    ],
                                    "text": "(27)"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        390.73,
                                        504.0,
                                        400.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Again, these inequalities can be checked by using only multiplication operations, thereby allowing us"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        401.58,
                                        504.0,
                                        411.52
                                    ],
                                    "text": "to check for exchangeable factors independent of the scale of their potentials while at the same time"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        412.55,
                                        504.0,
                                        422.41
                                    ],
                                    "text": "allowing for arbitrary permutations of arguments and even a small deviation between potential values"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        423.38,
                                        474.15,
                                        433.34
                                    ],
                                    "text": "without using any floating point arithmetics (if the potential values themselves are integers)."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        453.58,
                                        115.97,
                                        465.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "E"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        127.93,
                                        453.58,
                                        295.31,
                                        465.54
                                    ],
                                    "text": "Additional Experimental Results"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        473.07,
                                        504.0,
                                        483.13
                                    ],
                                    "text": "In addition to the experimental results provided in Sec. 4, we give further experimental results in"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        484.02,
                                        504.0,
                                        494.03
                                    ],
                                    "text": "this section. We again evaluate the run times of running lifted variable elimination on the output of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        494.89,
                                        504.0,
                                        505.09
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ACP as well as of running lifted variable elimination on the output of α-ACP and also investigate"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        505.85,
                                        504.0,
                                        516.0
                                    ],
                                    "text": "the average number β of queries after which the additional offline overhead of α-ACP compared to"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.64,
                                        516.7,
                                        504.0,
                                        526.77
                                    ],
                                    "text": "ACP amortises. The instances used in this section are identical to those used in Sec. 4 but we do"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        527.68,
                                        504.0,
                                        540.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "not average the results over the proportion p ∈{0.01, 0.05, 0.1, 0.15} of scaled factors. Instead, we"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        538.52,
                                        504.0,
                                        548.73
                                    ],
                                    "text": "present separate results for each individual choice of p to highlight the effect of p on both the run"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        549.51,
                                        478.78,
                                        559.47
                                    ],
                                    "text": "times for online query answering as well as on the offline overhead for constructing the PFG."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        107.69,
                                        565.95,
                                        504.0,
                                        575.84
                                    ],
                                    "text": "The results are illustrated in Figs. 7 to 10. Unsurprisingly, the run times of lifted variable elimination"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        576.81,
                                        504.35,
                                        586.94
                                    ],
                                    "text": "on the output of α-ACP remain constant for all choices of p because α-ACP is able to detect arbitrarily"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        587.64,
                                        504.0,
                                        597.7
                                    ],
                                    "text": "many scaled factors without forfeiting compression. At the same time, ACP is not able to detect"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        598.62,
                                        504.0,
                                        608.59
                                    ],
                                    "text": "exchangeable factors on different scales and thus, the run times of lifted variable elimination on the"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        609.48,
                                        504.0,
                                        619.66
                                    ],
                                    "text": "output of ACP increase as the proportion p of scaled factors increases. Regarding the amortisation"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        620.37,
                                        504.0,
                                        630.43
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of the offline overhead (depicted in the plots on the right), we can observe the same behaviour as"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        631.28,
                                        504.0,
                                        641.48
                                    ],
                                    "text": "in Fig. 5 (negative values for β are again omitted). The median value for β is always below one"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        642.18,
                                        504.0,
                                        652.39
                                    ],
                                    "text": "and there are no notable differences between the different choices of p. Even though the values of"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        653.14,
                                        504.0,
                                        663.3
                                    ],
                                    "text": "β slightly deviate between different choices for p, the deviation can be considered negligible and it"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        664.16,
                                        504.0,
                                        674.02
                                    ],
                                    "text": "seems as the deviation stems from noisy measurements. In conclusion, the additional offline overhead"
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        108.0,
                                        674.99,
                                        489.03,
                                        685.12
                                    ],
                                    "text": "of α-ACP amortises after a single query most of the time, highlighting the efficiency of α-ACP."
                                },
                                {
                                    "bbox": [
                                        301.18,
                                        743.01,
                                        310.15,
                                        751.98
                                    ],
                                    "text": "16"
                                }
                            ],

                                    ],

                                },

                                        503.99,
                                        241.86
                                    ],
                                    "text": "number β of queries after which the offline overhead of α-ACP amortises on input FGs containing a"
